definition: black horse/jet steed/good horse/legendary black dragon
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
Mt Li near Xi'an with the tomb of the First Emperor
pre-Han name of Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
to pluck a pearl from the black dragon (idiom, from Zhuangzi); fig. to pick out the salient points (from a tangled situation)/to see through to the nub
a black stallion or possibly a yellow mare (idiom); don't judge by outward appearance
Li Ji Rebellion in 657-651 BC, where concubine Li Ji tried to throne her son but was eventually defeated by Duke Wen of Jin 晉文公|晋文公[Jin4 Wen2 gong1]
a black stallion or possibly a yellow mare (idiom); don't judge by outward appearance

sentences.english: In the sixth century Liqian ceased to be used as a placename.
sentences.chinese: 在六世紀左右，驪靬這個地名就消失了。

definition: groom or chariot driver employed by a noble (old)
